abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Agricultural Service Project
            in Lesotho was implemented. The objectives were not achieved
            for lack of an appropriate input package, because of general
            disorganization and the failure to build-up adequate
            services. The Government appeared to be supporting this
            movement, but in 1983, with the withdrawal of Government
            funding, the extension service, such as it was, fell apart.
            Otherwise, the project was organizationally very weak
            because of the combination of limited Government
            administrative capacity and the co-donors' individual
            aims and interests. The first economic possibilities should
            have been accurately identified, notwithstanding the
            country's political imperatives. Before mounting any
            new agricultural projects it is essential to ascertain the
            range of economic possibilities in the agricultural sector.
